result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Michael Olsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.    $250 represents DNA surcharge.

No contact with: anyone under age of 18 without agent's prior written approval.    No contact with: Angela Graham without agent's prior written approval.  Not to date or reside with any person who is responsible for the care of anyone under age of 18 without prior approval of the agent.  Not to possess or use camera or recording equipment without prior approval of the agent.  Not to access the internet without prior approval of the agent.
Comply with Sex Offender Registration, GPS, and residence restrictions.    Submit a DNA sample.

Pay any medical expenses incurred by the victim re STD Testing.  Pay any expenses for treatment and counseling rising out of this assault.
Pursuant to Court Order dated 11/28/2017, no restitution is being sought by the victim in this case.
Any bond/bail posted shall be applied to any outstanding court costs/fees as allowed by Statute.

miscConds.notes: To be tested for any STD's and results of those tests to be forwarded to the victim, victim's guardian, defense attorney and parole agent.

superMiscConds.notes: Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.    $500 Represents the mandatory statutory 948.05 or 948.12 child porn surcharge x 6 for a total of $3,000.
